items.title: Lawsuit seeks to stop Trump’s $100,000 fee for H-1B visas
items.summary: Lawsuit filed against Trump’s $100,000 H-1B visa fee, claiming chaos for employers, workers, and federal agencies

items.title: Highways Dept. to put back Annadurai’s statue amid AIADMK’s protest in Tiruvannamalai
Two million people rally in Italy for Gaza as general strike halts key services
items.summary: In Florence, protesters approached the gates of the Italian national soccer team’s training center to demand its upcoming World Cup qualifier against Israel not be played because of the war in Gaza.

items.title: Government funding vote fails again in Senate as hopes fade for quick end to shutdown
items.summary: Although Republicans control the White House and both chambers of Congress, the Senate's filibuster rules make it necessary for the government funding legislation to gain support from at least 60 of the 100 senators.

items.title: In Karur, where there was no way out
items.summary: On September 27, thousands of people gathered in Karur, Tamil Nadu, to attend a rally by actor-turned-politician Vijay. As the chief of the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam party arrived hours late, the crowd swelled and surged towards his vehicle, triggering a stampede that killed 41 people and injured ove

items.title: CM to inaugurate Katpadi’s first government hospital
items.summary: The hospital will boast separate sections for cardiology, neurology, paediatrics, nephrology, obstetrics, and gynaecology. It will also have separate wards for emergency and accident cases

items.title: Aaditya Thackeray says he started the Mumbai 24/7 initiative in 2020; slams BJP for taking credit
items.summary: Aaditya Thackeray said that the BJP which criticised me on ‘culture and safety’ over my ‘Mumbai 24/7’ policy, has re-issued a GR allowing retailers to stay open

items.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs gets four years in prison for case involving sex workers, violence
items.summary: Combs was convicted in July of flying his girlfriends and male sex workers around the country to engage in drug-fueled sexual encounters, a practice that happened over many years and in different locations.

items.title: Trump says Hamas ready for peace, tells Israel to stop bombing
items.summary: “Israel must immediately stop the bombing of Gaza, so that we can get the Hostages out safely and quickly!” Mr. Trump posted on Truth Social.

items.title: Durga Puja is over, but Bengal colleges yet to complete undergraduate admissions
items.summary: The State Government will be finally closing the centralised admission portal on October 10, and it has asked colleges to individually fill up vacant seats after that date and complete the whole process by November 7.

items.title: Hamas says ready to free hostages; Trump urges Israel to halt bombing
items.summary: Hamas said that it accepts some elements of Trump’s peace plan, but others require further negotiation; Hamas official added that group will not disarm before the Israeli occupation ends

items.title: Scientists grow mini human brains to power computers

items.title: He reads, buys flowers and plays the ukulele. A dream man or is it all a performance?
items.summary: Competitors with tote bags full of sanitary pads and feminist literature faced off in central London.

items.summary: Clearance works have been completed in 62 locations by Thursday night, says GVMC Commissioner, adding that the works are on at the remaining 18 spots

items.title: Water Metro to commence services to Mattancherry from mid-October
items.summary: ‘Up to three ferries can berth at the floating pontoons at Mattancherry at a time, with one allowed to remain overnight, making it one of the biggest terminals’; ferries to run every 20 to 30 minutes

items.summary: Intermediate first-year students will write their exams from February 23 to March 24, while the final-year students will write their papers from February 24 to March 23

items.title: Money paid but no ship: The around-the-world cruise that is yet to set sail
items.summary: The BBC has been speaking to retirees who want the firm selling the cruise to stop advertising and refund their deposits.

items.title: Sales of electric cars hit record high in September
items.summary: Sales of fully electric or hybrid vehicles made up more than half of all new car registrations in the UK last month.

items.summary: Around 13,000 pet licences have been issued since August 2023, says senior official; decision on imposing penalties for unlicensed dogs is yet to be taken; city has reported over one lakh dog bite cases from January 2024 till March 2025; six GCC-run clinics set to begin microchipping next week

items.summary: According to officials, there were delays in floating tenders as the cost estimation for the project had to be revised

items.summary: Justice M. Jothiraman dismissed the pleas, taking into consideration the gravity of the incident, and that the probe was at a preliminary stage, and the injured were still in hospital.

items.title: Karnataka sees sharp rise in road accidents; Bengaluru among top five cities
items.summary: Among 53 cities across India, Bengaluru ranked in the top five with a 30.3% increase in accidents; it was preceded by Ranchi (50.3%), Varanasi (46.3%), and Pune (35%)

items.title: Advocate Ashwin Kumar Joshi passes away in Mysuru

items.summary: Districts like Purba Bardhaman, Hooghly, Howrah, Murshidabad, and parts of Paschim Midnapore especially vulnerable to flooding, district and police officials on high alert, says Waterways and Irrigation Minister

U.S. Senators question TCS, 9 others over H-1B visa filings after layoff of American staff
items.summary: The Senators said their “inquiry” comes at a time when the unemployment rate in America’s tech sector is “well above” the overall jobless rate.

items.title: 'Brave' Man Utd make 'statement' in Chelsea draw
items.summary: Manchester United end Chelsea's 100% start to the Women's Super League season in a "statement" draw, but they were left wanting more.

items.title: Police nab man from Bengaluru in ₹3.43 crore investment fraud

items.summary: While Bournemouth stars were leaving left, right and centre in the summer, one stayed - Antoine Semenyo - and he has taken the team up to second spot.

items.title: Former Rajasthan Assembly Speaker Girraj Prasad Tiwari passes away at 105
items.summary: Former CM Ashok Gehlot said Mr. Tiwari, who lived a splendid life up to the age of 105, was an example of discipline and vivacity

items.title: Senate stalemate sends US shutdown into second week
items.summary: Two separate funding proposals failed on Friday as mass lay-offs and sweeping cuts loom over the government.

items.title: Three Iranians arrested for cheating goldsmithery worker in Coimbatore
Pilots welfare group meets government agency probing AI 171 crash
items.summary: Airline Pilots’ Association (ALPA)-India demands observer status in the probe to ensure accountability and transparency. After meeting AAIB and DGCA chiefs, its president, Captain Sam Thomas, says the association has been assured of quarterly meetings.

items.title: Pakistan government holds second round of talks with protest leaders in PoK to end demonstrations
items.summary: At least six civilians and three police personnel have been killed during the ongoing demonstrations in the region. Nearly 172 police personnel and around 50 civilians sustained injuries during the demonstrations

items.title: Mirwaiz allowed to visit Jama Masjid after 3 weeks, condemns coercive measures
items.summary: Restrictions serve no purpose except to highlight the arbitrariness and high handedness of those wanting to rule by force rather than in the spirit of democracy, the Mirwaiz said

items.title: Centre fines ‘Drishti IAS’ for misleading advertisements

items.title: Russia regularly targets U.K. satellites: space command
items.summary: We're seeing our satellites being jammed by the Russians on a reasonably persistent basis, says Major General Paul Tedman

items.title: Book listing ‘set of 21 copper plate inscriptions’ to be brought out soon
items.summary: To be released by the Prime Minister on October 16; Archaeological Survey of India says it will contain inscriptions belonging to Vijayanagara, Reddi, Gajapati, Recharla Chiefs, Reddis of Rajamahendravarma, and Chamgalva dynasties and Nawabs of Kurnool
